chain_of_thought: [Article Type: Case Report] In this article, I found the following liver injury-related lab values and clinical outcomes: The patient is a 33-year-old female with pre-XDR-TB. During treatment, she developed TB-Sepsis with acute hepatic injury. The peak ALT was 213 U/L and peak AST was 130 U/L as mentioned in Phase 2. Other liver function tests like ALP, GGT, Bilirubin, INR, and Albumin were not specifically reported in the text. The clinical outcome was improved/discharged as both mother and infant recovered well with the mother achieving full neuro-recovery.
